div.p: No. 73/122, unit 4, p. 387, VPRS 7936/P1 outward letter press copy books of the Secretary for Lands, VA 538 Department of Crown Lands and Survey, Public Record Office, Victoria.

To proof.
By direction of the Honorable the Minister of Lands and Agriculture I have the honor to acknowledge receipt of your communication of the 3rd inst., and to inform you in reply thereto that since you became temporary Curator of the "Domain" arrangements have been made for vesting of all Metropolitan Gardens, Parks and Reserves in the Board of Land and Works, and, to assign to Mr Hodgkinson, who is a member of the Board, the general supervision of all such grounds.

The Botanical Garden, Domain Garden, and Domain Park, will be under a Curator, who, together with all employés in the Metropolitan Gardens, Parks, and Reserves, will be required to conform to such Regulations and instructions as may be issued by Mr Hodgkinson, as Permanent Head of the branch of the Department with which such lands will be connected.

I am to point out that it had become necessary to make permanent arrangements from the fact that your having informed Mr Casey that you did not consider your temporary acceptance of the Office, involved the retention by you of your Office after 30th June, instant, and from your having asked that your salary should be increased to £800 per annum, if the Government desired to retain your services after that date. — Although compliance with that demand was declined, and the demand subsequently withdrawn, it remained incumbent on the Government to make arrangements for the permanent management of the Parks and Gardens.
